title: 5 Simple Tips for Eating healthier Every Day
summary: Eating healthy doesn’t have to be a challenge, but it’s not something that you can just do a few weeks to achieve. Eating healthy is a lifestyle choice that can be achieved with a bit of planning and the right approach. Eating more whole foods is a simple way to ensure you’re eating healthier. Avoiding situations where there will be unhealthy temptations will also make sticking to your eating goals easier. Commit to doing something active every day - even if it's just a few push-ups.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`You see it everywhere these days: people talking about eating healthier, cleaner and more nutritious foods. Even famous athletes are getting in on the action. Superstars like LeBron James and Tom Brady are known for their high performance on game day as much as their off-season diet. The only problem with all of these healthy eating fads is that they can feel like a big challenge to follow every single day. But what if you could make it easier?
It\u2019t not crazy to think you can eat healthier every day. After all, you aren\u2019t permanently locked into an unhealthy lifestyle. Your habits change over time, which means your diet can too! You just need a plan to get there, which is why we\u2019ve outlined five simple tips that will help you eat healthier every day without feeling like a chore.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Plan Your Meals"),mdx("p",null,"If you want to eat healthier, you first have to plan for it. And this isn\u2019t about creating a detailed meal plan for each day of the week \u2014 though you can do that too if you want \u2014 it\u2019s about making choices during the week that will make your desired diet easier to achieve. This will mean shopping for the right foods, making time to prepare meals, and finding ways to avoid unhealthy eating situations."),mdx("p",null,"Keeping healthy snacks on hand \u2014 like fruit, nuts, and veggies \u2014 will help you avoid making poor choices when you\u2019re hungry. Avoiding situations where there will be unhealthy temptations will also make sticking to your eating goals easier. This doesn\u2019t mean you have to avoid social situations entirely but it does mean being mindful of what\u2019s available to eat and making the right choices."),mdx("h2",null,"Avoid processed foods"),mdx("p",null,"The less processed your food is, the better it is for your health. Simply put, processed foods are food products that have had some form of alteration in how they are made. This could include adding sugar, salt, and preservatives to food that doesn\u2019t require them, or taking something like corn and making it into something like corn flakes."),mdx("p",null,"Processed foods are typically high in sugar, salt, and fat, which means they\u2019re not exactly diet-friendly. Eating more whole foods is a simple way to ensure you\u2019re eating healthier. This doesn\u2019t mean you have to cut out all processed foods but it does mean making an effort to eat more unprocessed foods rather than buying the pre-made stuff."),mdx("h2",null,"Stick to whole foods"),mdx("p",null,"Whole foods are foods in their most natural state, meaning they haven\u2019t been processed or refined in any way. This means they are packed with more nutrients than processed foods, which means they\u2019re better for you in almost every way. If you ever find yourself wondering, \u201Cis this a whole food?\u201D the answer will probably be yes."),mdx("p",null,"Whole foods are better for your health, your weight, and your budget. They can be eaten as-is or added to recipes for an added nutritional punch. Whole foods are available in both fresh and dried forms. So, when you head to the grocery store, you\u2019ll want to choose fresh whenever possible."),mdx("h2",null,"Commit to exercise"),mdx("p",null,"Eating healthier is a great first step to a healthier lifestyle but you can\u2019t ignore the importance of exercise. You don\u2019t have to be a gym-hopping fitness fanatic by any means but you should commit to doing something active every day \u2014 even if it\u2019s just taking a walk or doing a few push-ups each day. This will help you stay healthy and will keep you feeling energized throughout the day."),mdx("p",null,"There are many different types of exercise you can try. You can go for a run, lift some weights, do yoga, take a brisk walk, or anything else that gets your heart rate up. Exercise will not only help you burn calories but it can also help you sleep better and improve your mood."),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t be afraid of healthy fats"),mdx("p",null,"Fats get a bad reputation but not all fats are bad. In fact, some are actually essential for good health, like the omega-3 found in salmon or walnuts. But fats in general get a bad rap because they are high in calories, which means people tend to avoid them as much as possible. This can lead to an unhealthy diet if you aren\u2019t careful."),mdx("p",null,"There are three main types of fat found in food \u2014 saturated fats, unsaturated fats, and trans fats \u2014 and they each have different effects on your health. While unsaturated fats are good for you, saturated fats aren\u2019t entirely bad. Trans fats have been shown to have the most negative impact on your health."),mdx("h2",null,"Final Words"),mdx("p",null,"When people think of eating healthy, they often think of it as a chore. Eating healthy doesn\u2019t have to be a challenge, but it does require you to make certain dietary changes. What\u2019s more, it\u2019s not something that you can do for just a few weeks. Eating healthy is a lifestyle choice. And it\u2019s one that can be achieved with a bit of planning and the right approach."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Comfort Food Recipes to Warm Your Soul

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`It\u2019s the perfect time of year to cozy up with a blanket and dive into a bowl of steaming hot soup, casserole, or other home-style comfort food. Who can resist the wholesome aroma of a slow-cooked dish? Not us!
These dishes are filled with rich and savory ingredients that warm you from the inside out. They\u2019re also easy to make in large batches, which means you can enjoy them for dinner for several nights in a row without getting bored. And because these comforting meals are easy to double or triple, they\u2019re also excellent ideas for homesick college students or anyone who misses mom\u2019s home cooking. So, don your stretchy pants and get ready to dive into these 15 yummy comfort food recipes this season has to offer\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: One-Dish Meals - Recipes for Busy Weeknights

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`It\u2019s almost a clich\xE9 at this point, but so many of us are busy these days. It seems like everyone is rushing from one activity to another and then logging long hours at work or school. As a result, we crave fast food and takeout more than ever before.
Thankfully, home-cooked meals are coming back in vogue again. People want to know where their food comes from and how it\u2019s prepared. There\u2019s also an emphasis on reducing stress levels by creating more time in our days with fewer obligations outside the home.
In short, people are becoming more aware of their health and making changes accordingly \u2013 great news for families everywhere!
One-dest meals are an excellent way to get back to basics and prepare wholesome home-cooked meals that don\u2019t take long to make or leave you with lots of dirty dishes afterwards. Read on for some great tips on how you can make one-dish chicken recipes part of your weekly routine once again\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Recipes for Using up Seasonal Produce
The Best Recipes for Using up Leftover Cooked

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Did you know that leftovers are the secret to great home-cooked meals? Think about it: Great home cooks know how to make leftovers taste even better. They use them to create new and different meals that everyone will love, instead of eating the same thing again and again until they can\u2019t stand it any more.
That\u2019s why we\u2019ve come up with this list of the best recipes for using up leftover cooked chicken. These recipes are quick and easy to make, but they also tick all the right boxes in terms of taste, nutrition and ease of preparation. In other words, not only do they all use up your leftovers in a delicious way, but they also make your life easier so you won\u2019t feel like you have to avoid cooking another chicken dish again just because you\u2019re fed up with leftovers!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make the Perfect Omelette

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`What\u2019s the perfect way to start your day? With a delicious omelette, of course! You can also enjoy an omelette as a light dinner, or any time you get hungry. Omelettes are easy to make and there are lots of ways to customize them with different fillings and toppings. Here are some tips on how to make the perfect omelette every time.
Whether you like yours with cheese or mushrooms, an omelette is one of the most versatile dishes out there. They\u2019re fast and easy to prepare, but most importantly, they taste amazing. So if you\u2019re ready to master this simple dish, keep reading for everything you need to know about making an omelette!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Simple Tips for Making Better Salads

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Putting together a healthy salad is usually the first thing people think of when they want to eat well and lose weight. Unfortunately, many people also associate salads with bad food because they\u2019ve had so many disappointing experiences eating them in the past. That\u2019s because most salads we see today are either served in large fast-food containers or come with an enormous amount of dressing that you need a spoon to get out of the little plastic tub.
However, there\u2019s no reason why salads have to be boring, sad excuses for food. In fact, a good salad can be one of the healthiest and most satisfying ways to eat greens \u2013 as long as you know how make it taste great without making it worse for you.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Ways to Use up Leftover Cooked Rice

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"When you\u2019ve cooked a batch of rice and there\u2019s just a little bit left, it can be disappointing. You might find yourself thinking there is no way to use that up and it will end up going bad before you find another use for it. However, this isn\u2019t the case. There are lots of ways to use up leftover cooked rice that are both delicious and won\u2019t see it go to waste. In fact, you might find yourself looking forward to cooking up a second batch so you can have some leftovers again! Luckily, these ideas will help you make the most of your leftover rice."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Keeping a balanced diet is essential for leading a healthy lifestyle. It can be challenging to eat the right amount of nutrients every day, but with the right information it\u2019s not as scary as you might think. Everyone has their own ideas about what healthy eating looks like, and that can make things confusing. You might have heard different things about what type of food is good for you and which ones should be avoided at all costs. But figuring out what the right kind of healthy is and how to achieve it isn\u2019t as hard as you might think. This article will teach you everything you need to know about eating healthily and getting the right balance of nutrients in your body."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Sourdough Starter - How to Make Your Own

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Sourdough starter is a mixture of flour and water that has been left to ferment. It\u2019s used to catalyse the fermentation process when baking sourdough bread, giving it a distinct sour flavour. Traditionally, starter takes weeks to make, but there are much faster methods using packaged yeast \u2013 see below. However you choose to make your own starter, the process is relatively straightforward and once you get the hang of it, an easy routine to keep up.
Sourdough has numerous benefits over other kinds of bread. It is easier for your body to digest than white bread because it doesn\u2019t have any gluten in it (gluten can be challenging for people with a sensitivity or intolerance). Sourdough doesn\u2019t have any added sugars either; just natural sugars from the fermentation process. It also has more protein than standard breads, which means it keeps you feeling fuller for longer.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
